question.body: A sprinter would experience muscle fatigue sooner than a marathon runner due to:

multiple_choice.choice: Anaerobic metabolism in the muscles of the sprinter.
Anaerobic metabolism in the muscles of the marathon runner.
Aerobic metabolism in the muscles of the sprinter.
Glycolysis in the muscles of the marathon runner.

response.feedback: Correct. Fast energy comes from anaerobic glycolysis, and is used by FG fibers. With training, sprinters would condition their muscles for speed, not duration.
Incorrect. Fast energy comes from anaerobic glycolysis; sustained energy comes from aerobic, oxidative metabolism.
Incorrect. Fast energy comes from anaerobic glycolysis; sustained energy comes from aerobic, oxidative metabolism.
Incorrect. Fast energy comes from anaerobic glycolysis; sustained energy comes from aerobic, oxidative metabolism.
